instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> booting to update screen
threads.message: This had extremely minimal liquid-damage around <CHIP>U4200</CHIP> and was booting to the update screen before we touched it. I cleaned up and reflowed <CHIP>U4200</CHIP>. It still just boots to the critical update page. Will boot fine in safe mode. Everything appears to be fully functional, but in safe mode the touch bar is disabled so I'm not sure about that. Battery is charged and fully functional. SSD is working normally. Any ideas?

threads.title: Another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> booting to update screen
threads.message: Did you try all the options from the old post about critical update?

threads.title: Another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> booting to update screen
threads.message: Yeah, nothing. I'm convinced this has nothing to do with networking issues WHEN there was damage to the board. I think it's just an issue with the board that needs to be fixed. My patience for this issue is extremely limited. Letting this one go.
